contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that Yahweh assigned to us ... that Yahweh assigned to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that was assigned to us ... that was assigned to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whose thumbs and big toes I told my men to cut off" or "whose thumbs and big toes we cut off" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who had their thumbs and their big toes cut off

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses had given Hebron to Caleb" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Hebron was given to Caleb (like Moses had said)

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the people of Naphtali forced the people of Beth Shemesh and Beth Anath to work for them as slaves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the inhabitants of Beth Shemesh and Beth Anath were forced into hard labor for Naphthali

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that God gave him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was assigned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "who had not fought in any of the wars in Canaan" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who had not experienced any of the wars fought in Canaan

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh left these nations in Canaan" or "Yahweh allowed these nations to continue to live in Canaan" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: These nations were left

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when he arrived at the place near Gilgal where people made carved images" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when he reached the place where the carved images were made near Gilgal

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Israelite army defeated the Moabites" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Moab was subdued by the strength of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form and you can make explicit why the roads were abandoned Alternate translation: "people stopped using the main roads; because they were afraid of Israel's enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the main roads were abandoned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "she killed him" or "he died" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was violently killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they noticed that someone had broken down the altar of Baal, cut down the Asherah that was beside it, and built an altar and sacrificed the second bull on it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the altar of Baal was broken down, and the Asherah that was beside it was cut down, and the second bull had been offered on the altar that had been built

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "we may kill him as punishment" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he may be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "calling them out to follow him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: and they too, were called out to follow him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "So those whom Yahweh chose" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So those who were chosen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what you hear will be encourage you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your courage will be strengthened

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Their camels were more than anyone could count" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Their camels were more than could be counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Gideon called out the Israelites from the tribes of Naphtali, Asher, and all Mannasseh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The men of Israel from Naphtali, Asher, and all Manasseh were called out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the kings of Midian wore" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that was worn by the kings of Midian

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "So Yahweh subdued the Midianites before the people of Israel" or "So Yahweh helped the Israelites defeat the Midianites" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So Midian was subdued before the people of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they buried him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When Jotham heard that Abimelech had murdered his brothers" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When Jotham was told about this

contextId.occurrenceNote: The passive phrases can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God did this to avenge the seventy sons whom Abimelech their brother murdered and the men of Shechem helped murder" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: God did this so the violence done ... helped him murder his brothers

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone told Abimelech about the men waiting to attack him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This was reported to Abimelech

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone reported this to Abimelech" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: this was reported to Abimelech

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone told Abimelech" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Abimelech was told

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they buried him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jair the Gileadite was leader after Tola" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He was followed by Jair the Gileadite

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they buried him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in an active form. Alternate translation: "Keep this promise for me" or "Keep this promise concerning me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let this promise be kept for me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They killed forty-two thousand Ephraimites" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Forty-two thousand Ephraimites were killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jephthah the Gileadite died and they buried him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Jephthah the Gileadite died and was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they buried him in Bethlehem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was buried at Bethlehem

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they buried him in Aijalon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was buried in Aijalon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "his wife's father gave her to his best friend" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Samson's wife was given to his best friend

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "bind you to control you" or "bind you to restrain you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: bind you, so you might be controlled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that have not yet dried" or "that are not dry yet" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that have not been dried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that had not yet dried" or "that were not dry yet" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that had not been dried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people can overpower you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you may be overpowered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If someone shaves my head" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If my head is shaved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "after the Philistines had shaved it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: after it had been shaved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which someone stole from you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that were taken from you

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "they" refers to the metal figures. This may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Micah placed them in his house" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were placed in the house of Micah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he called together the men who were in the houses near his house" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the men who were in the houses near Micah's house were called together

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "called these men together" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: been called together

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "kill you and your family" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you and your family will be killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: Change to active voice. Alternate translation: "we have plenty of bread and wine" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: there is bread and wine

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the people of Israel drew them away from the city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were drawn away from the city

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "we have defeated them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are defeated before us

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "He" refers to anyone who did not go to Mizpah. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "We will certainly kill that person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He would certainly be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "we killed all the Benjamite women" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the women of Benjamin have been killed
